TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit GacMembershipCondition extends System.Object implements class System.Security.ISecurityEncodable, class System.Security.ISecurityPolicyEncodable, class System.Security.Policy.IMembershipCondition

Docs.summary: Determines whether an assembly belongs to a code group by testing its global assembly cache membership. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks All assemblies installed in the global assembly cache are granted the `FullTrust` permission set.
## Examples The following example demonstrates the use of the GacMembershipCondition class.
[!CODE [System.Security.Policy.GacMembershipCondition#1](../CodeSnippet/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Security.Policy.GacMembershipCondition#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: public GacMembershipCondition ();
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="T:System.Security.Policy.GacMembershipCondition"> class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Code satisfies this membership condition if it is installed in the global assembly cache.
## Examples The following code example shows the use of the GacMembershipCondition constructor. This example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Security.Policy.GacMembershipCondition> class topic.
[!CODE [System.Security.Policy.GacMembershipCondition#4](../CodeSnippet/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Security.Policy.GacMembershipCondition#4)]

MemberSignature.Value: public bool Check (System.Security.Policy.Evidence evidence);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool Check(class System.Security.Policy.Evidence evidence) cil managed

Docs.param: The <see cref="T:System.Security.Policy.Evidence"> against which to make the test.
Docs.summary: Indicates whether the specified evidence satisfies the membership condition.
Docs.returns: `true` if the specified evidence satisfies the membership condition; otherwise, `false`.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This membership condition tests <xref:System.Security.Policy.GacInstalled> evidence.
## Examples The following code example shows the use of the Check method. This example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Security.Policy.GacMembershipCondition> class.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Security.Policy.IMembershipCondition Copy ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Security.Policy.IMembershipCondition Copy() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates an equivalent copy of the membership condition.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A copy of a membership condition is identical to the original membership condition.
## Examples The following code example shows the use of the Copy method. This example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Security.Policy.GacMembershipCondition> class.
[!CODE [System.Security.Policy.GacMembershipCondition#2](../CodeSnippet/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Security.Policy.GacMembershipCondition#2)]

MemberSignature.Value: public override bool Equals (object o);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance bool Equals(object o) cil managed

Docs.param: The object to compare with the current object.
Docs.summary: Indicates whether the current object is equivalent to the specified object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks There are no degrees of global assembly cache membership. An assembly is either in the cache or it is not. If the object identified by is a <xref:System.Security.Policy.GacMembershipCondition>, then the objects being compared are equal. This method returns `false` only if is `null` or if is not a <xref:System.Security.Policy.GacMembershipCondition>.
## Examples The following code example shows the use of the Equals method. This example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Security.Policy.GacMembershipCondition> class.
[!CODE [System.Security.Policy.GacMembershipCondition#5](../CodeSnippet/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Security.Policy.GacMembershipCondition#5)]

remarks.format:
## Remarks The FromXml method reconstructs a <xref:System.Security.Policy.GacMembershipCondition> from an XML encoding defined by the <xref:System.Security.SecurityElement> class. Use the <xref:System.Security.Policy.GacMembershipCondition.ToXml%2A> method to XML-encode the <xref:System.Security.Policy.GacMembershipCondition> including state information.

Docs.param: The <see cref="T:System.Security.SecurityElement"> that contains the XML encoding to use to reconstruct the security object.
Docs.summary: Uses the specified XML encoding to reconstruct a security object, using the specified policy level context.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The policy level context is provided for resolution of named permission set references. For example, code groups use policy level to find named permission sets.
